import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from catboost import CatBoostClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
# 1. Create family size feature
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

# 2. Create is_alone binary feature
train_df['IsAlone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# 3. Extract title from name (e.g., Mr., Mrs., Miss)
def extract_title(name):
    if pd.isna(name):
        return 'Unknown'
    title = name.split(',')[1].strip().split('.')[0].strip()
    title_map = {
        'Mr': 'Mr',
        'Mrs': 'Mrs',
        'Miss': 'Miss',
        'Master': 'Master',
        'Dr': 'Dr',
        'Rev': 'Rev',
        'Col': 'Col',
        'Major': 'Major',
        'Mlle': 'Mlle',
        'Countess': 'Countess',
        'Jonkheer': 'Jonkheer',
        'Don': 'Don',
        'Lady': 'Lady'
    }
    return title_map.get(title, 'Unknown')

train_df['Title'] = train_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)
test_df['Title'] = test_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)

# 4. Encode titles
title_encoder = LabelEncoder()
train_df['Title'] = title_encoder.fit_transform(train_df['Title'])
test_df['Title'] = title_encoder.transform(test_df['Title'])

# 5. Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

        return 'Unknown'

    title_map = {
        'Mr': 'Mr',
        'Mrs': 'Mrs',
        'Miss': 'Miss',
        'Master': 'Master',
        'Dr': 'Dr',
        'Rev': 'Rev',
        'Col': 'Col',
        'Major': 'Major',
        'Mlle': 'Mlle',
        'Countess': 'Countess',
        'Jonkheer': 'Jonkheer',
        'Don': 'Don',
        'Lady': 'Lady'
    }
    return title_map.get(title, 'Unknown')

train_df['Title'] = train_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)
test_df['Title'] = test_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)

test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# 5. Drop irrelevant object columns (Name, Ticket, Cabin)

test_df = test_df.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'])

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

        'Mr': 'Mr',
        'Mrs': 'Mrs',
        'Miss': 'Miss',
        'Master': 'Master',
        'Dr': 'Dr',
        'Rev': 'Rev',
        'Col': 'Col',
        'Major': 'Major',
        'Mlle': 'Mlle',
        'Countess': 'Countess',
        'Jonkheer': 'Jonkheer',
        'Don': 'Don',
        'Lady': 'Lady'
    }
    return title_map.get(title, 'Unknown')

train_df['Title'] = train_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)
test_df['Title'] = test_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)

# 4. Fill missing values

test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Embarked'].fillna(train_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
# 1. Create family size feature
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

# 2. Create is_alone binary feature
train_df['IsAlone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['IsAlone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# 3. Extract title from name (e.g., Mr., Mrs., Miss)
def extract_title(name):
    if pd.isna(name):
        return 'Unknown'
    title = name.split(',')[1].strip().split('.')[0].strip()
    title_map = {
        'Mr': 'Mr',
        'Mrs': 'Mrs',
        'Miss': 'Miss',
        'Master': 'Master',
        'Dr': 'Dr',
        'Rev': 'Rev',
        'Col': 'Col',
        'Major': 'Major',
        'Mlle': 'Mlle',
        'Countess': 'Countess',
        'Jonkheer': 'Jonkheer',
        'Don': 'Don',
        'Lady': 'Lady'
    }
    return title_map.get(title, 'Unknown')

train_df['Title'] = train_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)
test_df['Title'] = test_df['Name'].apply(extract_title)

# 4. Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Embarked'].fillna(train_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# 5. Drop irrelevant object columns (Name, Ticket, Cabin)
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'])
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'])

# 6. Drop PassengerId and Survived from training and test data
